name: Go
description: Go is an open source programming language from Google. It makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

name: Swift
description: Swift is a high-performance system programming language from Apple. It has a clean and modern syntax, offers seamless access to existing C and Objective-C code and frameworks, and is memory safe by default.

name: Rust
description: Rust is a multi-paradigm system programming language that originated at Mozilla Research. It is syntactically similar to C++ but provides better memory safety while maintaining high performance.

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language from JetBrains. It has full interoperability with Java, runs on JVM, and has type inference. I can also compile to JavaScript or native code (via LLVM).

name: Julia
description: Julia is a high-level, high-performance, dynamic programming language. While it is a general-purpose language and can be used to write any application, many of its features are well-suited for high-performance numerical analysis and computational science.

name: Elixir
description: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications. Elixir leverages the Erlang VM, known for running low-latency, distributed and fault-tolerant systems, while also being successfully used in web development and the embedded software domain.

name: Crystal
description: Crystal is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language with syntax inspired by Ruby. It is a compiled language with static type-checking and offers type inference.

name: Scala
description: Scala combines object-oriented and functional programming in one concise, high-level language. Scala's static types help avoid bugs in complex applications, and its JVM and JavaScript runtimes let you build high-performance systems with easy access to vast ecosystems of libraries.

name: Roslyn
description: Roslyn is the .NET Compiler Platform SDK. It provides open-source C# and Visual Basic compilers with rich code analysis APIs. It enables building code analysis tools with the same APIs that are used by Visual Studio.

name: Nim
description: Nim is a compiled, garbage-collected systems programming language with a design that focuses on efficiency, expressiveness, and elegance (in that order of priority).

name: Mono
description: Mono is a software platform designed to allow developers to easily create cross platform applications. It is an open source implementation of Microsoft's .NET Framework based on the ECMA standards for C# and the Common Language Runtime.

name: Clojure
description: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose functional programming language, inspired by Lisp and interoperable with Java. It is a compiled language that combines the interactive development of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.

name: Erlang
description: Erlang is a programming language and runtime system for building massively scalable soft real-time systems with requirements on high availability. OTP is a set of Erlang libraries, which consists of the Erlang runtime system and ready-to-use components mainly written in Erlang.

name: GCC
description: The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C, Fortran, Ada, Go, and D, as well as libraries for these languages (libstdc++,...). GCC was originally written as the compiler for the GNU operating system.

name: GNU Smalltalk
description: A free implementation of the Smalltalk-80 language which runs on most versions on Unix and, in general, everywhere you can find a POSIX-compliance library. An uncommon feature of it is that it is well-versed to scripting tasks and headless processing.

name: GHC
description: The Glasgow Haskell Compiler. Haskell is an advanced, purely functional programming language.

name: Elm
description: Compiler for Elm, a functional language for reliable webapps.

name: Apache Groovy
description: A powerful multi-faceted programming language for the JVM platform.

name: LLVM
description: A collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies.

name: Cython
description: Cython is an optimising static compiler for both the Python programming language and the extended Cython programming language (based on Pyrex). It makes writing C extensions for Python as easy as Python itself.

name: D
description: DMD is the reference compiler for the D programming language.
